docs.lead_paragraph: Anna Bennett, a senior at New York University, was puzzled about where to find research material for a nine-page paper. "The topic was 'Write whatever you want about a food group, recipe or ethnic food,' " she said. "The first thing that came to mind was Ethiopian food."

headline.main: With Latest Donation, N.Y.U. Food Library Joins Big Leagues

docs.lead_paragraph: ROSNER--Dorothy Abel, 88, died peacefully at home March 28, 2011, devoted children Barbara and Andy at her side. She was born December 27, 1922 in Brooklyn, NY, to Samuel and Mollie Abel, and is predeceased by her husband Harry (1996), brother William Abel and sister Ada Sterling. A first generation American, she graduated Thomas Jefferson High (1938); Brooklyn College (1942); and Teachers College Columbia (1945) with an MA in Foods and Nutrition. A brief stint teaching Home Economics in New York City was followed by a tour with the American Red Cross in the Philippines and on Okinawa as Club Director (Typhoon Terrace) in Services to the Armed Forces (1945-46), while her brother served overseas. She married Harry Rosner, CPA and lawyer in 1950. They moved from Brooklyn to New Rochelle, NY to raise their family: Barbara and Andy of N. California, David (Gloria) of Irvington, NY, and Martha of Boulder, CO. She was renowned for her hospitality, and her horticultural and culinary talents. She later worked as a nutritionist in the WIC program at New Rochelle Hospital. Her last professional assignment was real estate associate for Coldwell Banker in Larchmont, NY. In 2003 she relocated to San Jose, CA to be close to her California children. In San Jose she was active in the Willow Glen AARP chapter, serving two years as President. She will be greatly missed by Barbara and Andy, family and friends. Memorial service to be held in California.
